On to the food.  Three of us ordered the Chicken BBQ Pizza, Mediterranean appetizer plate and the Chinese Chicken Salad. 1.   CPK now has a new SMALLER PORTION menu all under $6.   The Mediterranean appetizer plate came with 4 pita breads, hummus and cucumber/red onion.  *  The hummus really wasn't anything special and tasted quite bland.  After spread the hummus on the pita and eating one, I had enough of it. 2.  BBQ Chicken Pizza had very dried chicken and the cheese looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp.  It looked like we got a previous canceled pizza order that had been sitting around for a while.  Not fresh and not impressed. 3.  The only thing I enjoyed was the Chinese chicken salad.  Hard to go wrong with salad when all you do is toss the lettuce, chicken and some vegetables with their special dressing.   Overall, my favorite CPK is in Burbank across the street from Ikea.  Pasadena location tasted similar to Glendale's location.  Just A-OK.
I've been here several times, and every time the food is just ok. Service is usually good, decor and seating is fine, but it's overpriced average food.
Excellent service from everyone we encountered. Jambalaya and pesto pasta were both delish! Can't wait to return.
This is one of the best pizza kitchen in the area the staff is great. The staff is attentive and friendly and very professional. Make it a point to come to this California pizza kitchen.
Good food. Great service! Manager visited with us multiple times and our waiter was patient and knowledgeable!

CPK is just okay in my book.  Nothing mind blowing, but the Jamaican jerk pizza is pretty good.  I'll come here for the occasional fundraiser and such.  Service is decent enough, but can get forgetful when busy.  Parking is validated in the adjoining structure for the first 90 minutes.

jayson is amazing he has been taking care of me for like 13 years already and he's been working here for about 18+ years.  i love his service every time i come in to eat or take food to go.  i enjoy sitting up at bar and watching the local sports games and enjoying a nice glass of wine.  thanks jayson for your amazing service! time in and time out you have proven to be the best at what you do! i will be back again!

This place is overpriced for what you get in return. We had.., Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza Chicken Tequila Fettuccine  Waldorf Salad (half order) The salad was the best thing and was still 10.59 for a half order. Our server was hard to find at times. She didn't bring out the complimentary bread, we had to ask somebody else. She would come refill my drink but not my fiancé twice. She didn't bring the promotional vouchers after our meal. She is a nice person, but not a very good server. I'll won't be back, unless I'm getting a deal.
Always happy to come here.  Good food. Consistent quality. Funny; this place is usually not crowded. But today being soooo hot. Seemed like everyone and their mother was here. Still, really good.

When you go to CPK, you basically know what to expect in terms of food. I gave CPK five stars and deservedly so for its service. My son has autism. Whenever we go to this CPK, everyone goes out of their way to accommodate us. In December,  there was a wonderful blonde greeter who not only went out of her way to give my son the absolute best service, but also spent a few minutes playing with my son outside in the patio as well. I am sorry that I do not know her name. The food is good, but the caring atmosphere is great!

Came alone for lunch during jury duty, and was very pleasantly surprised -- not only with great food, but excellent, friendly, fast service. (Thanks, Nathalie!) The manager (Alex) was told that it was my first time there, and personally delivered one of their new signature flatbreads (delicious) and thanked me for coming in. Seriously left feeling like a VIP!

I really love Margherita pizza it had a deep dish Chicago style to it that I really appreciate it. Besides that spaghetti was good not great but the pizza and the service is well I'm giving this place five stars

We stayed at a hotel near here so we decided to walk and get dinner at CPK, having never been to one. The wait for a table was about 20 min, which was right with what they'd warned. We were seated outside, which would have been great had there been more lighting. I enjoy a darker, outdoor dining experience but I do like enough light to read my menu. A real candle, an ample amount of string lighting, anything that wouldn't have made it necessary for my family to all use their phones as lights, would have been preferable. Not sure if the lighting was hidden and just not turned on, or if it was actually meant to be that dark, but when the food arrived, we could barely make out what we were eating. The place stayed busy, almost too busy for the servers they have. Once we were seated, it was about ten minutes before anyone asked us our drink order. To be honest, we were contemplating heading to the steakhouse next door. All in all, I'm glad we didn't. Once they took our drink order, the ball got rolling. Our server Jamie (I think that was her name-she was from NYC)-was awesome. Very friendly, and even though she was busy, she kept refills and everything going. There was also a male server that looked as though he was staying running; he had originally taken our drink order and also helped serve the food. Very friendly and upbeat. Another lady brought us napkins and silverware and for a first time visit, a free appetizer! Some kind of cheesy flatbread that my husband and kids thoroughly enjoyed, if the fact that they wolfed it down says anything. I was concentrating on the avocado club egg rolls we had ordered. If you like bacon, these are for you! Very tasty, with just enough tomatoes and avocado and the dipping sauces go well with them. Let's see, around the table reviews, my husband liked the ribeye a lot but wished there was a mashed potato option (were southern) :). But it was cooked medium, just the way he liked it. My oldest enjoyed his garlic chicken and veggies and the avocado ranch sauce & my youngest liked his pepperoni pizza, although he didn't care for the amount of basil. There is quite a bit. I got a works pizza and it was good, it could have used a little more sauce and cheese, but there were ample veggies and the meats were huge. Overall, we would go back. It had an above average chain food taste (reminded me of Cheesecake Factory somewhat), but the people made it a great experience. Thanks, Pasadena CPK!

The Food and Service in this CPK is Far Superior to any other CPK I have been in. The Staff always goes the extra mile to exceed the needs of their customers. I would recommend this CPK to anyone who is looking for a Great CPK Experience.

I have nothing bad to say about CPK. Free (validated) 90 minute parking in the underground garage, I've never had to wait for a table, always friendly service. There is indoor and outdoor seating.  Clean.   I love their pizza (my son is a pizza fiend) and I am so happy with their healthier options. I typically opt for the quinoa and arugula salad without the cheese. It never disappoints! So basic, so yummy. It is reasonably  priced - not cheap, but about average. It was $43 for four of us to eat earlier, including an appetizer. Oh and we had a good looking waiter which was the cherry on top, haha. It took about an average amount of time to get our food even though they were busy. Haven't ever had an issue with my order being incorrect or anything like that.  Personally, I'm a fan of CPK. This is the location I frequent most since it's so close to home.

I am extremely impressed with this place, my mother has always been a fan and I myself had not been to a California Pizza Kitchen in years. We had a family night and were seated immediately no reservation. They took our order and food came in a great pace, I did not feel they were taking long nor did any of my family but a manager came to the table to explain their "delay" and only 2 or 3 minutes later received the food. Everything was kind and warm welcoming. Extremely enjoyable, food was delicious and staff was amazing. Would recommend and cant wait to come back.

CPK used to be a dependable place - tasty food with decently sized portions and only moderately inflated prices. Now, however, the food is mediocre due to skimping on the key ingredients (aka, the ones highlighted in the menu) and with the portions drastically smaller the prices are effectively skyrocketing. With so many lunch options within walking distance, it's time to move on.

This is a beautiful location. We usually love the food at CPK. However ,this sever wasn't having a good day at work and it effected our dinning experience.We had to ask for extra napkins, a spoon for the salad, and fresh black pepper.   I feel bad that she was not in her best spirits,but when you are in a  customer service, you still smile and make sure that your customers are having a good experience.

Can you believe that I've only been here once in my life? I've always been surrounded by CPK restaurants wherever I go, but I just never found the time to actually eat at one until my sister's bday came along.  My sister made reservations for a party of 12 and they were really good about their reservations.  What do most people order? Pizza of course! It'd be dumb to come here and not try out their pizza if you haven't before. I decided to share an appetizer and a pizza with my friend and we ended up ordering a Chipotle Chicken Pizza along with their Macaroni and Cheese starters.  Also, like any Italian restaurant, they always serve you bread and olive oil as an starter. Chipotle Chicken Pizza really reminded us of well... Chipotle! except in pizza form. I enjoyed every slice of it, from the chicken to the onions to their sauce.  I'd definitely be coming back here for some more of this. On the other hand, their mac 'n cheese was not up to my par.  The cheese wasn't cheesy enough nor was it hot enough.  We like it hot 'n cheesy next time please! Also, for the birthday girl, they gave her an ice cream sundae and sang to her which is cool.  :).

After more than 15 years in Pasadena, I finally went to CPK.  I was given a really friendly greeting by the guy at the door and while waiting for a friend, the chef came over with a complimentary flatbread appetizer as a welcome.  Wow, how nice.  My food was really tasty and the service was excellent.  Right before leaving, i was given a cookie and coupon for my next visit.  Seriuosly, how many restaurants give people the first class treatment?  You guys rock!

Had a horrible experience today at the CPK Pasadena. All courses ordered --soup, salads, pastas & pizza-- arrived at the same time. The entrees were getting cold while we ate our soup & salads. We complained. The waiter was apologetic. Despite Caroline, the manager, acknowledging the mistake, she was offended at the frustration & annoyance expressed. Rather than apologizing, she asked us to leave & told us never to come back. (Surprisingly, she also comped the entire meal for our party of 6.) She left our table without providing an explanation & refused to come out from her office when we asked to see her to discuss. Next thing, security was at our table to escort us out of the restaurant. This is unbelievable! Unfortunately, no appreciation for our 30+ years of patronage. Guess you can't complain at CPK. Many other pizza places in Pasadena to go to that  care about the customer's experience.

Walked in and this nice gentlemen opened our door that was a very nice gesture . Sat down and we were quickly greeted by our waiter will" he was very happy and amazinly prompt in our service . Delish food , good service . Will return

Long wait for our entrees,   only 3 of the 4 meals arrived while the 4th was another 10 minutes. One pizza was stone cold, the other was heaped in mushrooms and in edible and the gluten free crust was the worst gf I've ever tasted. Very doughy and bland and undercooked.  To be fair the manager was very apologetic and offered us a discount. On the plus side, beautiful location, nice for an evening stroll afterwards.

It's our first time to eat at California Pizza. Me and my husband enjoyed the Jamaican Chicken Pizza and fresh lemonade strawberry plus they gave us a nice pizza bread which is on the house. The staff were very accommodating and friendly.

I just want to say Thank You to everyone who works at this location specially managed by someone with such a big heart Alex greeted my daughter and her friends who had just finished volunteering all day for the eggbowl which is an event held at the rose bowl for Easter for the children to partake in,  anyways he was real friendly and generous and payed for all their meals. Acts like this restore my faith in humanity.
loved our bartender erick! get the blueberry ginger smash cocktail. cpk is just cpk. nothing phenomenal, but hits the spot when it's what you want.

Tasty white corn guacamole! If you haven't tried it you totally should. Just wish it came with a little more but that's bc I'm a mega guacamole fan. :) I haven't had enough veggies lately so I went for the BBQ chicken salad. It was amazing. It's prob the first time I've tasted a hunt of basil in my salad. Not sure if that's normal or if some fell in there by accident. Either way - every bite seemed a little different but in. Good way. It went from BBQ chicken to Italian style with that basil over to a simple ranch salad at random moments.of you like flavor explosion and you've neglected your hot bod from veggies, just get it!

This is a better located CPK right at the business centre of Pasadena.  I like the view right at the door, a big fountain!  The menu has more food choices, but yea again I only ordered a drink ... If I get a chance next time I would like to try their appetizers, more variety & choices! Pricey place, but this location makes it more worth it.

Disappointing!  It was nice to have curb side pick-up.  Easy!  However, pizza was super disappointing.  We ordered BBQ chicken pizza.  VERY few toppings.  Lots of crust with not toppings.  Blah.  Tasted like it could have been a frozen pizza.  The only reason why it earned 2 stars is because of the ease of the curb side pick-up.

As a reward for such a great month my boss took me and my coworker (we are a small office) out to lunch. When he chose CPK I was a little surprised. I feel like in Pasadena you can get really good food for much less the price. I quickly ate my words though because CPK has grown up quite a bit.  I have always loved CPK (a guilty pleasure I know), but it gets expensive and repetitive quickly. I haven't been in a long time, so I was very pleased with the "upgrades" they have done to their menu. The new flavors are more bold and exciting, and there is a bigger diversity. I got the Korean BBQ pizza. Was it the best pizza I have ever had, not by a long shot, but it was still very flavorful and good.  CPK is what it is and must be judged on that. This is not a gourmet pizza place. You come here for food you know what to expect at a price you know. Part of me will always love CPK for what it is, but it will never be a standout for me.

We had a wonderful first-time experience here. They bring you a delicious flatbread appetizer if it is your first-time. They also bring a few pieces of bread with a oil based dipping sauce with spices. The pizza was fantastic (California Club - almost like a salad on a pizza) and was quickly prepared. Ask for Nicole, she's newer here but she is an absolutely superb waitress. She is outgoing, kind, conversational and puts great effort into her job. Couldn't praise her or our experience here more!
The ambience is wonderful. A very spacious CPK. The nicest one I've ever been in! And our server Sandy is super sweet and on point!

Maybe I just remember it being awesome when I was younger, or it was an off night, but the food was just okay and the service too.  Our food took forever to come out, and when it did, we didn't have utensils. Our server, who was very sweet all things considered, told us they were rolling them up in the napkins and we'd get them soon. This was about 5 minutes before our food came. I would just like to eat my food when it gets to the table so it's still hot please, the forks and knives don't have to be rolled into a napkin! I know it's all about presentation. Anyway my pasta got to the table and it was warm, but not hot. Like it had been sitting out under the heat lamps waiting to be picked up for a little while... plus I was still waiting for utensils. I was finally able to stop another server who brought us our rolled up utensils a few minutes later. I love CPK tho, and I definitely will be back. Just maybe not to this location.

This is a typical CPK... but I came here for lunch (for me and another colleague's birthday!)... so awesome free sundae! :D LOCATION:  Walking distance to work. Pretty big and there is parking available.  AMBIANCE: Typical CPK. SERVICE:  Good. They were attentive. I liked the host. He was really funny. FOOD: Got Garlic Chicken Pizza and Caesar salad... they were ok. I think the food brought the rating down.  Overall... this is a standard CPK. But got a free birthday sundae for my birthday!

I eat here when visiting for work - sadly the quality and service has declined. I placed a to go order and still had to wait 20 minutes when I arrived and they were not busy. The food, particularly anything with bread, was not fresh. I won't t return.

Great Service!  Also supporting our vets with two free meals was above!  Great service, we've been here plenty of times, always good food and good service! These guys know how to treat their customers and how to make a nice BBQ pie!
My Favorite is the Chicken Milanese without the cheese. But something everyone should try is the Tequila fettuccine and avocado rolls.

This is not the usual CPK, no parking here its next to the Westin Hotel and the city Hall. The inside decor is old.  During lunch hour the place was overwhelmed for take out orders. The manager had to step in and help push my order out the door and rang up my bill. I had luckily found a 2 hour parking across the street.

Wednesday Night Dinner. Vegetable Pizza with Goat Cheese - Great love the pizza. Mango Lemon Strawberry Cocktail - Great, nice tangy flavor. Mushroom Flat bread - OK The best part was the dessert suggested by the waiter, I do not remember her name.  She suggested the Butter Cake with Ice cream - OMG, this was the best dessert I ever tried. Thank You for the great meal and the dessert.

I love the CPK here, I always come late at night (like 10pm) so we never have to wait. They have a bar, if you want to sit there instead of a table. I prefer this one over, say, the one in at the Santa Anita mall, just because it's so faaawncy here ;) Good date spot, hahaa. The servers are always friendly, and the food is yummy! I definitely recommend the Chicken Tequila Fettucine. I order it. Every. Single. Time. Still not tired of it yet, and it's been about 3 years. Also, free parking - just be sure to get your ticket validated before you leave.

Always have a great customer service experience along with very tasty food at CPKs.  The experience at this restaurant was not the same. The food was very good, however, the service was less than desired. Jonathan was our server. At the end of our order I asked for fresh garlic and extra lemons for my water. We had to ask twice for the garlic and he brought the lemon slices near the end of our meal. We had to ask for refills. We asked for additional bread that never came. Again, this is not the normal great service we experience.

We had the worst experience on Friday 4/22..We just wanted to eat dinner however our server didn't think we deserved to eat at this location.. After waiting for more than 15 minutes for her we decided  to leave but not before speaking to the manager. We told her the waitress did not even acknowledge us at all after we were seated. However she acknowledged all the new people being seated..And to top it off as we were speaking to the manager they sat someone  at our table and the waitress  acknowledged them right away. She must be a Trump supporter...It's a shame that people like that still exist. We will never return to this location...

Seriously one of the best customer service places I've been to in such a long time. I felt like I was a celebrity, From walking into the door to leaving it was all so great. My friend and I were very pleased with the service. Our food got out really quick as well and the manager even came over to our table to greet us and welcome us for being our first time. That's what I call exceptional customer service and I would make the drive all over again just to go to that specific location even tho there is one less than 5 miles from me. Great job CPK! You have my business from now on!

I always come to the one on Los Robles in Pasadena. Their customer service is excellent there aren't too many places exercising customer service anymore. The staff was amazing. Food is always great..I was bummed when the waitress told me their Caramelized Peach Salad was no longer on the menu but she recommended the California Fresh Salad and promised it is definitely a pleaser. She was absolutely correct. This place is great!

Gave up on this place last year and tried again tonight. Once again, disappointment. Food is chintzy portion when ordered to go. Paid for avocado and got one tiny sliver cut into 12 itty-bitty pieces for $2.59. Cheap! My dinner salad was $17 and puny. The pizza crust used to be so good and now it is chewy and gross. Quality is just downhill. Even my kids said, "we don't want CPK anymore". Too bad. In the old days food was so good. Now it tastes like a fast food chain.

I'm generally a fan of CPK (I love their unique, diverse, healthy, and tasty menu items) and this location is no exception. I visited while traveling, and I'm glad I stopped here for some familiar tasty food.  The service at the Pasadena location was awesome! All the employees were attentive, welcoming, and professional. Our server was excellent, and he even recommended the Chicken Wontons when I was still hungry. We had the following: -Caramelized Peach Salad -BBQ Chicken Pizza -Chicken Wontons I love most of CPK's salads, and the Caramelized Peach Salad is one of my favorites! Overall, this location is great! Relaxing atmosphere (large dinning room compared to other cramped locations) and the food comes our quickly!

The food was good. Decent. Your normal CPK pies. The wait was alright. You have to understand, my group was tired and grumpy about the 626 night market fiasco... but CPK was pretty honest with us, they said the wait would take about 1 hour, and they were true to their word. Thank goodness for heaters outside, and seats! We were much more willing to wait around for a table for the 8 of us thanks to the heaters and outdoor seating. Also, we were STARVING! CPK will not give you bread as an appetizer unless you request it, so if you're super hungry like we were, ASK! We ordered a lot of food. Good flavoring, oh, and I loved my honey wheat crust on my pizza. You can request it on yours as well if you would like. Yum! Loved our server, she was sweet, on top of her ish, game face on! They actually had to put two tables together to accommodate our party of 8 which randomly bloomed to 9, so it was a bit of a tight fit, but it was still alright. The bathroom was a little tiny, but I think that was because there were oh maybe 5 bazillion hungry Asians scattering out to the nearby streets scavenging for food due to the over flooding of the 626 night market event that happened. We dealed with it. It ended up being alright. Overall though, your average CPK. Nothing super memorable in either a positive or negative way. However, you will have our eternal thanks for feeding all our hungry asses since the 626 night market fiasco was a lot huger than expected.

I enjoy going to CPK with friends and family. This location is one of the nicest one. It is big and newly updated, and it is located near the beautiful Pasadena City Hall. Parking is validated and free for the first 90 minutes.  Pizza is always good, but not extraordinary. Prices are a little high - pizza starts from 12.99, desserts are $8.49 (more expensive than the Cheesecake Factory?). The bill can easily reach $80+ for pizza and desserts only. I will probably stick to buying the frozen CPK pizza from Ralphs or Vons for pepperoni or BBQ Chicken pizza. There are also plenty of great and cheaper alternatives in the area.

Clean and professional!  Walking into this location, and fist thing you notice is how large this place feels. I think this location can sit about 150-200 people at any one time. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. I came here with my class of about 20 people. The hostess got us the back area so that our class could have some place to talk and discuss things.  We sat at the bar waiting for our class to get here the bartender Jason helped us out and was very knowledgeable about his alcohol and the food. I wasn't that hungry so I just got myself a lemonade and crispy mac n' cheese. It was a small perfect portion.  I think that this place I would come back for sure.

I have came to this location only once and I had a great time, and the service was great and fast. Went there about 2pm so it wasn't busy so I do understand why it was quick.  Our waitress, Brooke, was amazing to say the least. She made me feel like her best friend and was actually interested in what my dad and I had to say. She shared some of her personal life and so did we. This is something you never see these days. EVERY RESTAURANT NEEDS SOMEONE LIKE BROOKE. I will definitely be going back and seeing brooke :)

This place is fantastic for catering as well. My order is perfect every time and I always appreciate their effort. I usually pick up my orders and they have always been prepared on time. I serve many meals throughout Pasadena and CPK is my go to restaurant. My customers love their food and are always stoked to see what I'm bringing. Thanks CPK for making me look good!
Service here is great. Joined their reward program and got free flat bread every time for coming to eat with them.

Wine glasses placed on the table are rather presumptuous at a chain restaurant such as this.  As is the artificial five minute wait time, for which there is no apparent reason given plenty of seating and staff.  They'll offer you bread, but only serve it cold.  Nothing like some cold white sandwich bread.  Sadly, the butter (served with the bread) was probably the best part of our meal.  Gift cards placed on the table are also rather presumptuous. CPK's are staffed by people who are trained to verbally suggest specific upgrades, appetizers, and desserts.  Their actual feelings and emotions have been trained right out of them, or at least until the end of their shift. The spinach and asparagus spaghetti was completely void of flavor and was clearly lacking an ingredient. Saw the manager walking around a few times.  He seemed to hate his job.  I would too if I were a California Pizza Kitchen Manager. Fake pizza box art on the wall is stuff that only Thomas Kincaid could appreciate.  If he weren't dead. I only came to California Pizza Kitchen because I had a gift card.  My visit confirmed that California Pizza Kitchen is not a place I want to spend my money.

I've always liked the food at CPK, though I usually go to the one at the mall in Arcadia. Always loved the Kung Pao Spaghetti. The pizzas are great, too. But I want to comment on the take out service here. I tried calling and after 4 minutes no one (no live person) picked up. I was in the parking garage at work and figured I would place my order by my phone . Tried again. I was driving by then. They finally picked up after more than 5 minutes on hold and telling you it's easier to order online! arg!! Then, I got like a 100 questions while placing the order! Spell your first and last name. Soy you want a beverage? Do you want ice cream with your dessert? OMG I'm practically there by now! Then she asks me what is the make and model of my car. Twice. Finding the so called car pickup spot was another five minutes. She never mentioned where that was located. These places think they are so convenient but they have people answer the phone who have no consideration for the customer or no clue. Of course the food had not arrived at my car in the promised time. Took way longer. What a shock! I am still waiting for the order. I only hope the food is worth the hassles.

I love CPK. I've been coming here for ages. And over time they have remodeled, changed their menu, but remain scrumptious! It's easiest to park in the garage underneath, but don't worry, they validate at the restaurant. I love that CPK gives you a complimentary serving of bread. Free food? Free bread?! Yes please. The avocado spring rolls are a delicious starter. It's like a mini club sandwich in an egg roll. Hot. Seriously, it satisfies and whets your appetite. Okay, so this is the California PIZZA kitchen, so the specialty here is the pizzas. My favorite is the tostada pizza. I love Mexican food, and this is basically a burrito on a pizza. And I'm not generally a thin crust pizza, but I really like the crust. I suggest getting it with chicken though because otherwise it's kind of plain. Three non-pizza entrees that are yummy in the event you do not want pizza: the Kung pao spaghetti, the jambalaya, and the Waldorf salad. The first two are pasta dishes, both flavorful and spicy. The salad is fresh and yummy with all of the apples! One final note: the moscato on the wine list is a MUST HAVE. Yes.

This one and the Santa Anita location are about the same distance from me, but I normally go to this one.  This location is 100x cleaner, friendlier and the food is consistent and not overcooked.  There is parking downstairs in the structure and they validate.  It's a lot easier than trying to find parking at Santa Anita.  Their martinis are always delish and I never have a problem with substitutions.  I can get almost anything on the menu and sub the meat for avocado.

I can always count on CPK to be a great restaurant no matter what city I'm in. I love their choice of appetizers and their "small cravings" menu. Going here with my kids is always pleasant and enjoyable. They love the coloring book kids menu and it makes going out to dinner fun and exciting for them. Food: I've tried a few different dishes here, but my favorite would have to be the mushroom ravioli. Ask them to mix the red sauce and the white sauce to create a unique "pink" sauce that makes the dish delicious.  Drinks: Their cocktails look good, though I've never tried any. I always order the peach iced tea and I'm never let down. Not too sweet and not too bitter. Just right. My kids love their smoothies.  I've never had a problem at this CPK, and their food is always up to par. I'm certainly going to be back here with my kids for another night out with them!

I went there for both lunch and dinner yesterday.  They were hosting a Fundraiser for an organization I support (which is awesome when businesses support their local nonprofits).  For both meals I was served by Armando.  Seriously, the most pleasant guy ever.  He was friendly and attentive when I was there for lunch with coworkers, and just the same with a twist of playful when I was there with friends for dinner.  He made excellent recommendations on the food and drinks.  Things that were ordered that all received positive reviews: BBQ chopped salad, Thai salad, cobb salad, Asian pear martini, B-52, Mai Tai, Top Shelf Long Island, Raspberry Lemon Drop, pizza (the tostada in particular), tequila chicken penne, quesadilla, tortilla soup, dumplings, spinach and artichoke dip, spaghetti, fried mac n cheese, pumpkin cheesecake, and the lettuce wraps.  All good stuff.   And Armando, good stuff.  He says that he is there everyday, but Sunday.  Sit in his section and enjoy!

Unorganized staff bad food and long wait. This place is the worst food experience I had for a long time. To make our dinning experience better we order the kids pizza first but I got my food faster. We had wrong sandwich served to our table and ...
nice locations and offers parking with nice ambience. it does offer parking with validation.

Our family came here to meet with a family friend of my wife. We were greeted promptly and introduced to our server Brian. Brian was a extremely was very personable, courteous and timely. The decor and atmosphere was also nicer than most other CPK's I've been to. I must admit, this is one of the nicer and friendlier CPK's I've visited. The staff sort of knew  via our server, that we were visiting from out of town. The good part is they just let us be...they didn't rush us. I kept asking for them to tell us when to get out, but they were no, don't worry we here and have lots of work to do, please take your time with your family! Besides the food being of great quality, the staff here were top notch on the customer service aspect of things as well, starting with our server Brian. Sometimes, your experience isn't all about the food, but about how well you were treated as a guest in their home! CPK of Pasadena, you guys did good!

Casual ambience,  delicious food.  I gave it 4 stars because we had to ask for everything with our server.  I ordered a pizza and ALL CPK's,  even if you don't want it,  offer you parmesan cheese and chili peppers. We had to ask like 4 times to turn on the heat warmers.

I enjoy eating a California Pizza Kitchen when we can't find an independent smaller restaurant to support. Their thin crust wheat dough is great on the pizza (you need to request wheat if you want it), and their salads are great. My favorite is the Morrocan Chicken salad. It's delectable explosion of flavor with small bits of dates, butternut squash, avocado and other little goodies.  This particular location was very pleasant. We decided to drop in while walking around and they had a lovely outdoor dining option. On a Sunday afternoon, it was quiet and relaxing and the service was very friendly.

Coming from Berkeley, a place with very few chain restaurants, eating at CPK seemed wrong. My fears were founded though.  While the service was phenomenal (except for a longer-than-needed wait time), the food wasn't exceptional. I got a pasta plate, which was good - but just that. My associates got salmon and the tricolore pizza. Both were good - but not amazing - especially for their price. Their tortilla soup was delicious though - my favorite part of the meal. Servings were average-sized. CPK tries to make it seem as if their flavors are adventurous, but you're better off exploring at a smaller, mom-and-pop place. CPK is a great place to bring guests if you need a consistent restaurant with quite decent food. But I wouldn't come here often by myself (or with a date).

I had a great visit with one of my best friends at this location! We both got Garlic Cream Fettuccine and it was perfect. Well cooked, well sauced, great flavors. Our server (Starlene) was super awesome and I think everyone who goes in should ask for her section.  The only downside to our visit was a group of woman and their kids - who were running around the restaurant like wild children. I am not faulting the restaurant, as they put a stop to that REAL quick. I am normally not a chain restaurant person, but I don't mind going back to CPK...especially this location. Good job guys!

Went to CPK for a Thursday lunch. There is plenty of inside dining and a sprinkling of outdoor seats for those that like to bask in the sun. I'm one of those and there was exactly 1 table left outside, but my colleagues preferred indoor, so I yielded to the seniors. One gripe about this place is the indoor table set up. There this nice spacious dining room set up in the front of a wide bar area, then there are the black sheep tables behind the bar that feel pretty isolated from the rest. Guess where they sat us? -=-Thai crunch salad-=- Pizza is good here and they have good customer service. You can't go wrong with the pizza, so I'm going to rate something that isn't so typical here. The Thai crunch salad was good for a light-ish lunch. The best part about that was the peanut dressing. The crunchy wonton strips could get a little carried away on top, but it makes it taste good, so it's hard to turn it away as unhealthy as it is. Chicken is pretty forgettable on this plate, because there was barely any of it. Regardless, I'd get the Thai crunch salad when I don't want the heaviness of a pizza here.
Took my pregnant girlfriend here for her first time today and it was great, refills could have been faster though.

My husband and I have been here only two times and it's been a very positive experience both times. The fact that they open the door for you when you enter and exit is nice, but what's even better is their service. Each time the server has been the nicest, down to earth, friendly and attentive. My husband is always indecisive when ordering at a first time restaurant and this last time, our waiter, Luckes, made some great suggestions which we ended up loving. This is our spot, even though Glendale CPK is closer.

I am mainly writing this review for the CHICKEN PICCATA dish.  I LOVE IT!!!  CPK has had this dish for a couple of years i believe, and a couple years ago it was NOT very good.   I went here a couple of weeks ago and ordered this dish again and it was FABULOUS!  Wow, what a difference.  The chicken, pasta, sauce, is just cooked perfectly, non dry and so juicy.  I was amazed, and the flavor, oh boy, the flavor is sooooo good!  I hope they don't change this dish from now on.  I think is PERFECT! I don't give CPK 5 starts because i think that their pizzas are kind of ODD, and they are not my favorite.  They are okay, but not the best.  That's just me.  But i do give the chicken piccata 5 stars.  Definitely!

Came back to CPK for the first time in years because it's kid-friendly.  Happy to report that the food is the same as ever - solidly good "middle American" fare.  The field greens salad was fresh, and the tortilla soup was the same - tasty and hearty without being too thick. The service at this CPK was very good.  The host was very friendly to us and our nephews, as well as the waitstaff.

Just an update to comment on the acoustics in this place.  While I enjoy their food, it is extremely difficult to carry on a conversation when this restaurant is crowded.   Huh?  What did you say?????????????????????????

Service: Sorry, but the waiter was definitely not into his job. Maybe he was having a bad day, but at least pretend to enjoy your job. The manager provided better service. She refilled the pepsi & even our waters! I would definitely tip her, but the waiter didn't even stop to tell us about the desserts when he brought the dessert menu. The place wasn't even that busy on a Sunday afternoon. Food: Normal CPK :) Ordered: 1.  wardolf salad, which was delicious [grapes, blue cheese, spring mix, walnuts, etc.] 2. Meat lovers?? Delicious i think it was bacon, sicilian ham?, pepperoni, and sausage 3. I forgot the name, but it has everything on it. For example, peppers, onions, olives, sausage, pepperoni, etc. It was okay. 4. Atmosphere/location: Honestly, Old Pasadena is just A-status & historic. Located by banks, law offices, and the westin hotel. I cannot get over the high ceiling and the bar is amazing! I would definitely attend happy hour if permitted! So many choices from wine to beer and vodka! I would have given this place 4 stars, but I am all about the service. The waiter ruined the experience for me & the manager saved him.

Ordered Thai chicken pizza and was so salty. I mentioned this to he waitress and she just said that could happen. I asked them to try the sauce and they never did. They didn't seem to care too much that it tastes horrible when I shared the info with the.  I wasn't looking for a discount or not to pay. Just giving them feedback.

I am lactose intolerant. I ordered the Tostada Pizza without cheese or dressing. The kitchen made my pizza with cheese. Our waiter, Dex, not only noticed my pizza was wrong, but proactively spoke with the manager, Dion, to have a replacement pizza made ASAP. Dion and Dex handled the situation excellently. They even brought over an appetizer so I could snack on something while my boyfriend started his pizza. Good, consistent food with great customer service!
Their new arugula and asparagus salad is the best! I also love the quesadilla sauce and most of their new items.  The outdoor area is really cozy with a nice view. Great service!

I usually come to CPK every couple of months. Its a decent place to get pizza, especially if you're in the mood to get something a little different from your traditional pepperoni pizza. I got the roasted garlic chicken pizza with the whole grain dough. It's pretty good, although today it seemed they over cooked it slightly, as the crust was really well done. Service was a little slower than usual, but they were busier than what I usually see. It's usually pretty good, so I'll let it slide today.  I'll be back soon to fill my 'gourmet' pizza fix.

When I was first seated, it was done in a 'so-so, yea, here is your seat, sit down.' kind of manner, however, I realize that that was the problem with the host, not the waiters. the food, (Tequila Lime Fettucini) was absolutely delish! the waiters were always checking up on me, and I had a good time! Will surely revisit!
This is one of the Best CPK's in LA! I've eaten at most of them. But this is by far my favorite! The service is super fast, and the drinks are great! Also you get 11/2 free parking!

CPK is great almost anywhere you go.  The staff at this particular one is a little rude sometimes but try to brush it off as an "off day". But the number of times I've gone vs. their happiness... sketchy...  They do delivery on weekdays from 11-2! Super convenient when you get a little lazy but the food portions maybe a little skewed and unfair and they sometimes forget things.  Make sure if you want bread and butter you tell them.    With that said -- YUM! (and honey wheat dough is the way to go).

This has always been my favorite CPK out of all the other CPKs .. maybe because I am in love with the outdoor seating.  My usual pick at CPK: Original BBQ chicken salad.  I'm sure everything else on the menu is also mouth-watering deliciously amazing, but I always seem to end up with the BBQ chicken salad. :o)  For a person who isn't a BIGGGGGGG lover on salad, I can't get enough of CPK's bbq chicken salad. Trust me on this one. :) P.S. I love how they light up candles for your table if you get outdoor seating during night time.

Eat here often.  You really can't go wrong with CPK if you're looking for a basic pizza.  Staff is friendly and they allow me to order a cheese pizza with grilled chicken and avacado.  It always comes out exactly how I want it.   Actually ordered salmon once and it was better than expected. The pasta is good too.

One of the best CPK Restaurants I had been to. Over the past years, I have been two CPKs, the one in Santa Anita Mall and the one in Brea Mall. They are both excellent in service and food; however... Pasadena tops all. Why? The waitress, she was SUPER friendly. The Santa Anita Mall never allowed us to split checks for parties over 4+, but the waitress today allowed us for a party of 16 people. Amazing! She made us all separate bills, that is one the amazing things ever cause usually other restaurants do not allow that. Not only the waitress was friendly about the checks, she offered help to cut the cake and other little things. The hostess was also wonderful, even though she was not our server, she had always updated which seating was better and easier to get. She suggested the patio seating because it would be quicker and our wait did not take longer than 15 minutes (on a Saturday night).  The patio was very cold! But they had two heaters for us, so it was really warm and it did not feel like we were freezing at all and outside was actually very calming and despite being outside, they often checked up on us regardless of refills or questions. The food quality and taste was the same as other CPKs, delicious. I always found their pizzas to be very average even though the flavoring is really unique unlike Domino's or Pizza Hut of course. PLUS: Validation, own parking lot. Nice arrangement of restaurant =)

Like any CPK--packed packed packed at dinner.  WE ate at the bar because we wanted to get in and out in an hour in order to catch a flick.  CPK has a shitty wine selection but good beer on tap.  (Sierra, Red Car) I really must implore you to get the Miso Salad because it was so wonderful.  Great flavors, delicious dressing, fresh and light and filing at the same time. And I love the CPK white bread.  Well, I love all bread so I guess that's not saying much.   Without a doubt, you pretty much know what you are going to get every time at a CPK.  No surprises, but sometimes reliability is a good thing.

I wish i could give negative stars. WORST CPK I have been to. Been here maybe 4-5 times and each time the customer service was horrible. The staff is not attentive at all. I thought it would change each time going back but the service is slow and we always have to ask for things to get done. The staff seems very lazy and under trained. Water is always empty, waiters are hard to flag down, and check takes forever to get. Don't waste your time at this location. We always make the drive out to the Arcadia location if we are craving CPK.

I love this place!!!! I stop on a frequent basis. Maybe I should consider buying stock shares? Anything and everything on this menu looks and taste awsome. Worth stoping by if you havnet. I cant get enough

I don't really understand what is going on with CPK, the food at one time was really good. Tonight we ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza...it was a disaster...mind you we pick up our takeout delivery curbside...cold and rather grey looking. The full Cesar Salad was also a disappointment with few croutons and little cheese. I remember we used to get really great bread and butter...ours came with sourdough and some weird spicy olive oil in a tiny plastic container. What's up CPK?

I love CPK's in general, but there is a level of expectation at most of them.  People are usually friendly but aside from that, you get your pizza, eat and leave.  We celebrated my future sister in law's 30th here. Normally they do not take reservations, but after persistence from my brother, they agreed.  It was a surprise, so we all got there and waited for our section to be ready.  We had almost 30 people there, so they gave us a whole area. The two waiters assigned to us introduced themselves and were SUPER DUPER nice.  They got our drink orders and gave us lotsa bread while we waited for the birthday girl. The waiters were super attentive, friendly and helpful.   They let us split the checks by table and made everything easy. Overall, was very impressed.

Very Impressed! This was my first visit to a CPK and have to say I loved it. I took my wife for her birthday and luckily we made reservations cause the place was packed!  I was very impressed when one of the managers "Dion"  came over to seat us personally when he overheard me mention my wife's birthday. He was very friendly, and said if we needed anything to just let him know. It was a great start that got even better. Our waitress "Erika" was very friendly and helpful recommending items that we might like considering we had never been there. We ended up ordering 2 appetizers(Avocado Club Egg rolls, and Dynamite Shrimp) which were both delicious and left us craving more. For dinner my wife ordered the Garlic Cream Fettuccine(which I ended up eating half of) while I had the California Club(I have somewhat of a sandwich fetish). Both were amazing, great portions, and the price was well worth it. We we're offered a free sundae for desert but since we had eaten so much we had to turn it down. I scored some major points starting our date night with CPK. Will definitely be going back!

This is a "go to" place if you don't have anywhere to go last minute.  CPK won't let you down because their food is pretty good.  I always order the roasted vegetable salad ever since it came out last year.  It's filled with roasted sweet corn, artichoke, bell peppers, asparagus, eggplant, and lots of avocado!!

This is CPK, if you had it before, it's the same. I like a little more substance in the dough. Even the hand tossed dough is too thin for me. I do like the options of non traditional toppings. I'm still a big fan of the "bbq chicken."

I love CPK! First off I don't like how you now have to ASK to get bread...We didn't have to a couple years ago. I think their bread is nice with the butter!  I always get either the cheese pizza or the chicken lettuce wraps. They are very tasty. I like how they show the nutrition facts...even though they're bad :( ahhaa.  GUILTY PLEASURE= Their RED VELVET CAKE. I love it SOSOSO much!

As a member of the US Army Reserves it was nice to have a location that offered a full meal including a basic beverage.  Most of the other locations that I looked up had food free, but not the drink... CPK stood above the rest and offered ALL DAY service WITH DRINKS!  onto the actual experience. Greeted right away coming in the door.  I was in my civi's so I wasn't distinctly military from looks.  Plus I need a hair cut, although I always keep my face clean shaven when going somewhere to represent that I am in the Army.  Anyways... So, a slight wait, just enough for me to utilize the latrine(rest room).  It was amazing because right when I come out and back in position the hostess is ready to take me to my table. My server, Omar, did a wonderful job introducing himself and making me feel valued.  Explaining what was part of the offer with dignity and once my order was taken, he did his job to check up on me just enough to refill my drinks and offer that little bit of service.  - "want some bread while you wait for your pizza?" I wish I wasn't going through  hard times financially right now or I would have given a full bill tip.  Next time I come around I will have to ask for Omar so I can give him his due.
Server was Jenny she was great but my advice to the cook is find another job my fish in my fish tacos was burnt manager very nice but please find a new cook
Crowded, but efficient.  This location seems like it does a pretty robust take-out business.  CPK tastes like CPK whether it's in Pasadena or in San Diego.

Two things that set this particular CPK apart ...  (1) You can have lunch in the patio -- which I love to do in a beautiful pasadena afternoon  and  (2) They have a new dish calledd the Moroccan salad which is SOOOOOOOOO good.   Maybe they have this salad in other CPK's but I've never noticed it.  I just found a new favorite dish for CPK!
the feel at CPK is one of comfort. its a very relaxed and laid-backed setting. The pizzas are the best. The California Club pizza is the best pizza by far.
The pizza is very original, but to small.  I think the portion will cause you to be more hungry after you eat.

Fabulous food  and terrific service.  This used to be our every-thrusday-night place but its a bit heavy on the wallet.  Wine for a 9oz pour (standard size wine class) starts at 10 bucks per glass.  If the cost was about 15% less it would be a 5 star place but .... because its a bit over priced it gets a 4 star.

The CPK here isn't nearly as good as some other locations.  This place still gets crowded but it shouldn't take long to get seated.  Service is a bit slow but not too bad.  The pizza they gave to me was just bland and there was hardly any flavor with any of the ingredients.

Recently had my 1st to CPK ...... I was not impressed with food or the waitress. I had the Hawaiin Pizza - it was too small and over priced ( $ 12.50 ), it resembled a personal pizza that can be purchased at a lower price at any other place. The food was nothing to get excited about. I've had better pizza from other places .... Papa Johns, Pizza Hut and B.P Pizza Co .  The waitress got several orders wrong within my group .... She blamed it on the loud music - what loud music - tip for the waitress - clean your ears and listen to your customers.

working in pasadena today and decided to grab lunch at cpk with my coworkers very close walk from work, so that was plus once we got there, we got seated immediately i ordered the full cpk cobb salad w/ blue cheese dressing and beets on the side. YUM! my coworkers ordered a miso and chinese chicken salad our food arrived within 10 minutes cracked pepper please salad was delicious and nutritious staff was kinda hit or miss, and this time it was a miss prices were average, bout $12 - $15 a salad
i like the pasadena CPK... plus on a nice warm day, it's perfect with outside seating..
Being italian, when it comes to pizza, I'm very demanding. Sugar in the dough is not ok!

Good pizzas and salad, decent service, seemed somewhat understaffed, but our waitress had a good attitude about it... Enjoyed the garlic chicken pizza.  Waldorf salad is one of my favs.  Parking validates only 90 minutes and is expensive after so watch the clock.

After having a wonderful meal we came here for some dessert and an alcoholic beverage.  All in all this place is really good as well! Getting seated took only like a minute or two, and the atmosphere was pretty silent. LAKER'S lost to the Clippers and Bronco's lost to the Patriots. Somber night I guess. Our waiter was a little scary at first but then he opened up to us and ended up being the coolest guy all night! The service was pretty good, the drinks came within 5 min and our dessert came 5min after that. Food quality was excellent as well especially since it was dessert!   If I could say anything about this CPK it would be that the staff are very friendly and very inviting. It makes one want to stay and "have a beer" with them.

There is only a handful of chain restaurants I would miss if lost in the current downturn. CPK is one: the absolute best carne asada pizza & chicken tequila fettucine! Park for free after 5 on metered streets west of City Hall - the sights are worth the extra steps!
last time here was about 2 years ago...we all shared pizza and salads, favorites were the bbq chx salad and bbq chx pizza! service was a bit slow due to grad parties!

I love CPK! All their locations are the same and make the same taste as any CPK spots. I usually get their chicken tequila fettechini or however u spell it and I tell them to make it spicy. The flavor changes into a whole different dish which I like! I love spicy food so check it out if u like spice too. Pasadena location is dope too with private parking underground. Make sure to validate ur ticket so it'll be FREEEE!!

This place is all about LOCATION!  It is very close to Pasadena City Hall which is amazingly beautiful.  It really is nice to go during the spring/summer months and sit outside for lunch.  The food is like other CPKs which means average to good.   *Food = average but beautiful surroundings makes the food taste a little bit better. *Service = average *Ambiance = very nice, beautiful flowers, birds, architectural buildings.

It's funny how often one gets dragged into eating at chain restaurants to "celebrate" a friend's birthday. Eating at CPK is considered a sacrifice for me, as I do not like spending money on tasteless food plus slow service.  This particular CPK is also on the bottom of my list. When the bread came, it was cold and as hard as a brick. I had to stab it a few times before I could slice through in order to butter it. The butter was also hard to spread. You can tell a lot about a restaurant just by the bread they serve. I ordered the gorgonzola cheese and walnut salad (something like that, it wasn't worth remembering). It was just "okay," definitely not worth the 13 bucks or however much it was. Again, I wasn't too surprised because it IS CPK. If you want a good pizza, go down on Fair Oaks towards South Pasadena to "Mama's Pizza" for some authentic New York-style pizza with FRESH toppings and for half the price.  I cannot emphasize this enough: When in Pasadena, STEER CLEAR OF THE CHAIN RESTAURANTS!!! There is so much culture and several mom n' pop places to choose from. Don't limit yourself to the over-hyped, over-rated American chains.

The husband and I dined here on the patio for lunch today. I always expect bread and butter automatically when I come here but had to ask for it today. We ordered our regular: a full Waldorf Salad and Jamaican Jerk Pizza (my longtime fav). Food was delicious, as usual. Husband had the peach lemonade... It tasted yummy!

Overall Restaurant Chain: CPK is typically my go-to restaurant when I want to go out to eat non-fast food with friends.  They have a number of dishes suitable for vegetarians, and in fact, they provide fairly detailed information on their website of dishes that are suitable for lacto-vegetarians, vegans, etc. (I love it when restaurants do this! It's great for customers and it  saves their customer service department from having to answer the same questions over and over).  My favorite dish is the Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant Pizza.  It is slightly sweet, but has sundried tomatoes, which provide a tangy taste as well.  I always get one pizza for myself, but most people I go with usually end up having a slice or two left over to take home.  This Particular Restaurant Location:  This was a central location between where me and my friends live, which is why I decided to come to this particular restaurant.  Additionally, I had read on yelp that the restaurant was located by a nice fountain plaza with lots of outdoor art.  When I got to the restaurant, I must say, the plaza was quite underwhleming. To be fair, it was night and there were hardly any lights in the plaza, so if there was nicely decorated wall around it, they were hidden. You would think that at least the fountain would have decent lighting around it, but then you would be wrong.   It did, however, look like it would be a nice place to sit and relax during the day.   Right across the street from this restaurant are several other restaurants along with some high end stores.  It wasn't too busy when we were there, but it seems more like an afternoon hot spot. The Service: I had called ahead earlier in the day to make a reservation for me and two of my friends. I figured since it was apparently located next to such a nice plaza, it would be packed on a Saturday night. But I was told by the person on the phone that they don't take reservations far in advance, and she didn't think we would have any trouble getting seated quickly (after seeing the plaza at night, I can see why).  I was told I could call about an hour before I was planning on coming in and ask to be placed on the waitlist, which I did.  The place was fairly busy, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated. While we were waiting outside the restaurant, one of the waitresses came out and offered us a sample of a new artichoke, spinach, and chicken pizza they had, which was nice.  My friends tried it and gave it a thumbs up.  The service was great throughout the night. The Food: There's not much to say here, it tasted as good as every other time I've had CPK.

Overall I would give the time there a 4/5. Right when we got there we waited about 5 minutes before the hostess asked us if we needed help. Once we told her that we needed to seat 20 people she said that it was no problem but the room that would be able to accommodate all of us would not be ready until a little after 6 and that the server that would be in charge of us would not start their shift until about 6PM as well. At about 5:30PM or so she came around and asked if any of us wanted drinks and promptly served us the waters and/or ice that we had asked.  We ended up getting seated at 6:04PM but after that we were left to rot in the 'sun room' until about 6:35 or so. The waitress started off with a bad first impression since she was taking drink orders while trying to put on the last of her uniform. She struggled to remember who had ordered which drink and the food took a while to come out but once she got those out of the way she started to pick up a rhythm. Our drinks were always full and she was happy to fix anything if we had a complaint: My chips were stale so she brought me new chips in about a minute. The waitress, Autumn, was very friendly and honest when asked a question and in the end I'm glad I had her as a server. The location of the CPK is a bit hard to find a first because it looks like a bank but it is on a street corner so it is easy to get to once you spot it. Most of the parking is street parking or public parking if you pay to park in the lot next to it. The inside is very nicely decorated even though you wouldn't know it was any bigger unless you walked around to see. The floors are a bit slippery but the bathrooms are very nice. I'm not too sure I'll go there again with a large party but I'll definitely go with a small group on a day that I have some free time.

I love me some CPK, I usually go to the one in the Santa Anita Mall, but I've been to this one a few times.  I always notice cute waiters at this location too for some reason:;);) Anyway, the bbq chicken pizza with added goat cheese is yum, another one of my favs is the roasted pepper and goat cheese pizza.  Not crazy about the Greek pizza cause of the yogurt tzatziki sauce or the carne asada pizza...it's kind of heavy.  The Tri colore pizza is yum, and it's a bit lighter, it's like a thin crust dough with salad on top.  Usually I share a pizza and a salad entree with whoever I go with...and it hits the spot!  There is a parking garage and you take the elevator to the floor of CPK on street level...I think I usually pay 2$ coming out of there.

I like a knucklehead, accidently placed my online order to the wrong CPK location.  Without realizing this I showed up to the Arcadia location. Waiting for my order that was taking longer than normal to come out.  I called the number again, and they told me they had gone outside and did not see my vehicle.  I then noticed that the curbside number on the Arcadia poster was not matching the number I had been dialing.  The Arcadia & Pasadena Managers worked it out so that my order, (which was already cooked and ready for pick up in Pasadena) was cancelled; and I placed a new one for Arcadia since I was already outside in their curb already.  The Pasadena Manager did not hesitate at all, he refunded me what I had initially paid, and to top it off he was super nice about it.

For Parents Only: Ever had a meal when it's just your kid and you. I didn't feel like cooking. So 3 year old and I venture out for a quick and easy meal. It's better than fast food and affordable. Appetizer: Chicken Tinga Quesadilla ($5) This wasn't very big at all. But I didn't feel like a large meal. Plus my kid won't finish her food so I will nibble of hers. I liked this cuz the  flavors were just enough to be an adult dish. A bit of spicy and and a bit more texture than my kid's mac'n'cheese.  Kids Mac & Cheese ($5.50 comes with a kids drink) It's mac&cheese. The kid will love it. No complaints there. The drink is all sugar but I always ask for another cup and we dilute.  Out the door and definitely under $20. No bad for a quiet date with my 3 year old.  Disclaimer: Not responsible if you kids decides to scream through dinner although they do have fun activity sheets to keep any toddler occupied for a period of time. Have fun.

This was our second time eating here.  We received a giftcard as a christmas gift.  Both times it was busy, the first time it was dinner time, second time it was lunch time (well 2-ish).  We waited for a table for about 5 - 10 minutes as stated by the Hostess.  The ambience of this restuarant is nice, lots to look at, plus tv's at the bar.   Once seated our server (each time) greeted us almost immediately.  Each time our food was fresh, delicious, right temperature, and the wait time for our food was realistic for waiting for brick-oven cooked fresh-at-the-time-of-ordering pizza.   They have a huge selection of food items besides pizza.  And each time we went we noticed a lot of families, a lot of children, so it's a great place apparently to bring the rugrats too. The prices are a little higher than you'd expect for pizza but it is gourmet, fresh, and so we were happy with our giftcard!  If you haven't tried it, it's definitely worth the try!  And Pasadena is a beautiful city, so you can eat your pizza and dessert and then walk around the city.  Oh and they Valet your parking ticket too! =)

Haven't been in a CPK in a long time, a few years probably. Came for lunch on a Saturday. My wife ordered Shrimp Jambalaya and I had the Hawaiian pizza. In terms of food, was tasty but wish they would use a little more toppings, was a bit sparse. My wife liked the Jambalaya but thought it was a bit too spicy for her liking. Service was great, was checked on every so often to make sure our drinks weren't low and we were happy. Overall a good experience,

CPK is always a good choice for a quick, casual meal.  The food really doesn't vary from location to location, and this one did a decent cheese pizza and field greens salad.  I ate here with my boyfriend the night before we started the California bar, and it was about as relaxing as it could be, excepting the other patrons who were clearly talking about law.  The outdoor patio is lovely, with pretty views of the Plaza Las Fuentes and the regal buildings of surrounding Pasadena.  Service was friendly and prompt. There were a number of adorable babies around, and we saw one poor kid totally eat it on the concrete.  I went to CPK several times a year throughout my childhood, and I imagine that if I had kids I would visit CPK fairly often.  There are better dining options, of course, but if you just want an easy meal, CPK is a fine choice.  As far as chain restaurants go, it's definitely one of my favorites.

They have QUINOA on their menu. And half pours, which are perfect if you are in need of a fix but still have to go back to the office afterwards. Great outdoor seating that overlooks the plaza by the Westin AND you are away from the crowd at the Paseo. Wish it was just a bit closer so I can come here more often for lunch.

Well after 30 mins of waiting we finally got our section for a party of 8. The server was very nice and brought our drinks and appetizers fast. But after that it all went down hill. We waiting for about 45 to 50 mins before we got our dinner. We were pretty upset and not only that they burned my wife's pizza. The edges were black. We told the server and she even said it herself that it was not suppose to look that way. After complaining she replaced it but after waiting for almost an hour and having a burnt pizza at that my wife had lost her appetite. This place really sucked. We were not impressed and ayer waiting so long ir validation for parking had expired so we end up paying for that. One thing for sure my family is never coming back. If you only knew how long we waited you would have hated this place as well.

This place is usually busy whenever I go, however it is clean. I have two items on the menu that I crave at any moment of the day...the California club pizza, and the four cheese ravioli! Anyone should try there's they're instant favorites.

Pizza! Pizza! If you like gourmet pizza, then CPK is the place for you. Been a fan for a while. The ownership of CPK has changed hands a few times, but the food still remains consistent. You can't go wrong with any salad and pizza combination. If you're on the  protein diet, you better go next door. This is CARB city. From my last count, I've been to 15 CPK including the one in Indonesia and Singapore. Honestly, the service is 1000% percent BETTER in those countries than the US. Service at CPK has always been average or below, don't know where they find these servers. Food is always good, but service brings the overall grade down. The food can be a little pricey, so bring your sugar daddy. Have fun and enjoy!

Busy Sunday and we got right in. Service was good, server made recommendations. Split the California Club pizza and Moroccan Spiced salad. Salad was excellent, pizza was good, needed more cheese. Small selection of draft beer. Clean and great location

Why do I even have to give 1 star?!??!  We order food for catering from different restaurants for different occasions on a regular basis. This time we decided to try CPK, so I went to the one in Pasadena to place a rather large catering order. Naturally, I had a few questions regarding the menu and the items I wanted to order. Usually wen we place catering orders, the manager or whoever is responsible to take your order is happy to answer any questions regarding the menu and the quantity needed for the number of guests you have etc. but at CPK the person in charge for taking the order, Michele, had no clue. With my first question she turned to another person working in the kitchen and requested the answer, that person referred to the menu I was holding in my hand which obviously  did not have the answer and hence was the reason I needed to ask the question. So with that question (about the number of sandwiches on each tray/platter) unanswered, I proceeded with another question about which sandwiches could be served cold and which ones had to be warm upon serving, at this point Michele said "i have another customer I need to help" and left me standing for so long that I chose to leave and place my order for 50 guests at a different restaurant that actually appreciated the business.

Being that this location is so close to my office, one would think that I would come here more often. The allure of the Paseo and Colorado Blvd overpowers the thought of actually walking one block north! However, for a quick and easy lunch, this is great option. I think restaurants can be judged by many criteria, however it all comes down to the bread and the iced tea! They have a great black iced tea (and the best part is they don't mind offering you an iced tea to go!) I, like many of you, I'm sure, are always trying to "watch it"...right? Well, as much as I love the flavorful options, pizza, or dessert, I've found a few favorites that won't kick you off the wagon. 1) the tortilla soup--creamy, but not too much, 2) the quinoa and arugula salad (a must have! I loved it so much I've tried recreating it at home!), 3) the lettuce wraps are surprisingly good, 4) the chicken tinga quesadilla (get extra chipotle sauce, you'll thank me later!) Yum! A combination of any of these is a great lunch, healthfully conscious and won't leave you sleepy when you roll back to the office.

My first time here, came for my bestie's birthday. It was... Okay. Nothing to rave about. I got this creamy pesto pasta dish. The flavor was alittle bland, and the pasta was kinda dry. I wouldn't get it again. My friends enjoyed their pizza, server was pretty attentive, and my friend got a free Sunday for her birthday!

The works pizza is a mustwe ordered  it with the thin crust dough and it was delish!!! The spinach dip is a great starter... The quesadilla was fresh but lacking a little punch, the soups and salads are all fresh and tasty!!!

I've been to many CPKs before, but I had one of the best experiences at this one. My boyfriend and I took the Metro Gold Line to Memorial Park Station and the walk from there was definitely manageable. A special Valentine's day menu was being offered at the time, but we already knew our favorites/usuals-- I've been a big fan of the small plates and salads, while my boyfriend enjoys the pastas. Our server was very personable and timely. The decor/atmosphere was also nicer than other CPK's I've been to.

CPK has always been a favorite of mine. This location has been great. The staff is usually very nice and the restaurant is very clean.  I like the spot they are located here in Pasadena, Nice building. Always get a table in about 5 min. or less. Close to old town too!

Was here for the first time on 11/4/12 with the wife.   Service is a big ZERO Food is a 1 The place had maybe 8 tables with customers, 3 tables with about 6 people.  So not many people.  Went about 4pm.   10 mins to get seated 15 mins to get a server to take our drink order. 25 mins to get our food. I was really looking forward to what this place is all about.  Its all a bunch of hype. The food sucked.  Got a Margherita Pizza, avacodo rolls and Penn Pasta with shrimp. I'm sooo not picky with food and very patient with service. I can get waaaay better food at a local mom's and pop's pizza place for cheaper and better taste. The Manager was decent and nice enough to apologize for the bad service.  She said the staff was switching to dinner staff.  But it was a bad experience for us.  Sorry CPK, never going back.  Good Luck!
BBQ Chopped Salad has always been one of my favorites I also like this location because it's not as busy as others

I like other CPKs but not this place. It took long before our meal came up so we asked our waitress how much longer it would take. She said "I don't know because I don't work in the kitchen" The meal itself was so-so

Pretty decent CPK location. Parking is in the lot underground and restaurant is never really full when I pop in. Service is quick and it's the same dependable CPK chain food they serve everywhere. I do appreciate that they offer curbside service at this location, too.  For those unfamiliar with CPK's menu, I suggest the pear and gorgonzola pizza, which is pure heaven. It's also a serious splurge, so be sure to hit the gym afterwards. The basic salads (wedge, artichoke n arugula) are pretty good, too, and they are actually a great size and a great calorie count. I'm a fan.

I have been going to CPK ever since it began, and to many of it's locations, and have always ALWAYS been happy.  Not so this evening.  My family and I went there to celebrate my son's birthday like we have for many years because it has forever been his favorite, and not only did they mess up his simple cheese pizza, they did it in a insulting way.   They were headed to the table with a pepperoni pizza, saw the mistake, turned around and seconds later returned with a cheese pizza with basil to hide the pepperoni marks.  Unbelievable!  When I called them on it, they feigned ignorance and took it back... only to return with a new pizza... over 15 minutes later when the rest of us were almost finished.  And it was 5:30.  The place wasn't even busy yet.  Not until I called them on it did the manager begrudgingly comp the new pizza and then even more begrudgingly, boardering on hostiley, comp the entire dinner when she saw how disappointed and upset my family was at the bate and switch that they tried to pull.  She did not do it with class or graciousness, but rather with no real genuineness and never even returned  to see if there was anything else she could do. Rather she avoided eye contact for the next 20 minutes and so we left without having a birthday cake.  I realize that one simple family does not make or break a big business like CPK, but I was sad for the first time tonight at how many wonderful experiences over these many years was so tainted by such a dismissive way of dealing with us.  It felt like "comp their dinner and get them the hell out of here" was the attitude of this manager.   Well, they succeeded in that, I suppose, because we won't be returning to what used to be my son's favorite anf traditional place to have his birthday dinner. Very sad way of dealing with such loyal customers.  Oh, well.  All good things must end, I suppose.

I love the food at CPK, so if you're a vegan or have specific dietary requirements, the CPK website makes it simple for you to determine which menu items that do/don't fit your needs.   My favorite items are the Grilled Vegetable Salad or Vegetarian w/ Japanese Eggplant Pizza (with Neapolitan dough, cheeseless). Pros:  Service is quick and friendly.  Food is delicious.  Restaurant is clean.  Parking is easily available in the underground lot.  Be sure to bring your parking ticket to get validated. Cons:  Can get pretty busy on the weekends around dinner time.  If you're a slow eater, you might have to pay for parking.

I am not normally a fan of chains of any kind but, the really enjoyed my experience here today.     The food was good a solid 3.5 but the attentive wait staff pushed it to 4 stars.   An error in our order resulted in an offer to immediately correct the problem by a manger.  When the person indicated it wasn't necessary to redo the order....he comp'd her lunch.  The grilled salad I split with a friend was very tasty and good sized portion.   Everyone at the table seemed to enjoy the salads they  had ordered too.    Although the noise level is not wonderful..would come again ..especially since it is within walking distance of the Pacific Asian Museum and the Pasadena Museum of California Art.

We go to this CPK a lot -- not just for the food, but because the servers are really terrific, especially Starlene, Armando & Dario. If something isn't right, the manager is VERY quick to take care of it. Customers are treated very well. I love the thin crust pizzas! It's always a positive experience here. You can either park on the street or in the lot around the corner. CPK validates your parking, which I believe gives you 90 minutes, so parking is never an issue. That's another big plus.

Great place.  The personnel is friendly and attentive to details.  They have new items on menu every so often.  Some stay, some are just seasonal. Sonia is the best waitress I've had in a restaurant chain.

I just went to CPK and I had 4 different orders.  They forgot to put one of my orders (soup) in the bag.  They immediately contacted me and told me that they were going to drop it off at my place of work.  Which they did and instead of one soup they gave me two.  CPK of Pasadena gets 2 thumbs up from me.  Robert is a great manager and I would definitely visit again!!  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

. . . . TWO AND A HALF STARS . . . . CPK. . . it is what it is. I briefly read some of the other reviews, and apparently they all have the same consensus. It's pathetic that CPK doesn't take it's consumers/customers more seriously.   My mom and I ordered "curbside" service a few weeks ago - and comes to find out, THERE IS NOT CURBSIDE SERVICE AT THIS LOCATION!. . . The guy on the phone didn't confirm the order, and didn't tell me my total, and failed to tell me there was no designated curbside - it also DOES NOT state that there is no designated area on the website, fyi. We complained via online, and got a certificate for an entree and a drink (whoopie!), and a stupid letter apologizing for the service and stating that there is no designated parking - um. If they KNOW there is an issue w/this curbside stuff, why don't they let people know when they're calling in?  I went there last night to eat, and it was pretty busy. We didn't mind the wait since it was nice outside. . . I felt that the wait was comparable to anything else around - i.e. Cheesecake, Yardhouse, Villa Sorriso or PF Changs. . .
