The hostess seemed a little scattered, but pleasant. Forgivable since it was a little chaotic w/all the people, noise level and the amount of KIDS that were around.  Our server didn't mention her name, but she was genuinely nice, and was pretty on top of all her tables. Our drinks and food came pretty swiftly, but like I said, this is CPK, so it was up to expectations.   Other than that, it was pretty uneventful and normal.  *** FYI *** CPK validates for parking (an hour? hour and a half? . . .), the UNDERGROUND PARKING lot is on UNION. . . parking is definitely a hassle. Since they share the parking lot w/East West Bank, the Westin, and others, there is limited parking - even though there are three underground levels. There is also street parking, but it is metered. Make sure you read the signs for times allowed, etc. Pasadena is a stickler for giving out tickets (= $$!).  On a side note, this place is GREAT for kids. . . there seemed to be an over abundance of little people running around. If you want a place where the atmosphere doesn't care that you have your child, CPK is a good location. I brought my 5 month old daughter, and I wasn't worried that she'd make too much noise or be a distraction to "romantic diners". . . ;o)

Went here last night for company's gathering.. where should I start? Foods are decent, price is okay, our waiter was helpful and nice: 4 stars for all of these.  The reason why I gave 2 stars for this place, is because the hostess needs to learn how to count, use her imagination and common sense, she escorted us to a round table which is fit for 9 people only, hello? we were 12 adults and 2 infants, need 01 high chair and 01 stroller space since the other baby is still 4 months old. we were like elbow to elbow to each other, sat uncomfortably and she made a comment "It should be fit" Finally she moved us to other long table, which we still had to wait.. The manager was a disappointing factor too, he's just a guy with a shirt and a tie walked around and do nothing. better off do something and make yourself useful. never coming back to this place anymore. I'd rather go to other branch or better one like cheesecake factory.

Another joint for people who would rather "settle" for cheap pseudo pizza.  Numero Uno in east Pasadena is WAAAAAY BETTER. You know you're in trouble, when they feature a BAZILLION hybrid pizzas. We were feeling dangerous and decided to order the "Carne Asada" pizza. It cracks me up thinking of it.  It was awful, the asada was dry, and bland and each slice could only hold 1-2 pieces of steak at any given time.  This place has turned into a  BAD fusion pizza joint.  Next time we're gonna try the orange chicken pizza, oh wait, THERE WON'T BE A NEXT TIME! Yuck.

You cannot go wrong with CPK because their food is so consistent.  I used come to this one often because I had to stay at the Westin for a while (2 months, but that's another story).  I love the jambalaya and salads.  I like how I can walk to the fountains and city hall after dinner at CPK.  It was quite romantic with my hubby.  I miss eating here and taking a walk afterward.

I don't think I could give a CPK a five star review. What's next....a raving, gushing writeup of the Olive Garden?  First time I tried CPK was in Palm Desert. I was a New Yorker back then, and my pizza experience was limited to a reliable slice at the Ray's Originals in Manhattan. The thought of  Thai Chicken pizza was repelent, but I was open minded. I turned out loving it.  There are hits and misses. Does the world need a Greek Salad Pizza? Mmmm....my guess is no. What's next....the Top Ramen Pizza, Sicilian Style? But I love the tequila lime cream sauce chicken fettucini thing. It's fusion that works beautifully and is always well executed. Can you say the same for a typical Italian restaurant? It's a crap shoot, usually....either sublime or sucky.  So give it up for CPK....if you're going chain, this is as good as it gets.

First let me say: It is what it is.  That is, a chain of fancy pizza restaurants.  I went there on a date with mild reluctance but found that it was a really lovely place to have dinner.  If you eat outside, there is a bit of a park right there and the kids can run around the fountain.  The service was really above par with the host seeing our parking note and asking if he could validate it - just like that!  How thoughtful!  And our server was very efficient and friendly. Also, I had the honey wheat crust and loved it! So, not the coolest place ever but for what it is it's really the best! Rebecca
this place never lets me down. hearty portions, comfort food, decent prices and friendly staff. Irrespective of to go or dine in order good quality food is always guaranteed

This CPK I went to was in Pasadena, L.A. and it was last Saturday night, 8 Nov 08. I liked the place but have had better pizza. I think it was the crust that really put me off of the pizza I had. Seemed really bread like and not pizza crust like; the flavor and texture seemed different. The menu was chock full of choices to include a variety of pasta dishes. Flavored lemonade was made with syrups and not fresh ingredients (like strawberry lemonade). The service was quick, but not rushed, despite how crowded it was.

I hadn't dined here for several years but went back a few days ago. The food was predictably average and typical for a chain restaurant. I had the Kung Pao Pasta, it just wasn't as good as I remember it being. The tiramisu, on the other hand, was delicious, and definitely worth trying!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Me and the fwends come here all the time. It's the spot. Great service, delicious food and a full bar! SpinDip for life!!

We went after peak dinner hours after becoming impatient waiting for seats at other nearby restraints. We were seated quickly and the waitress was super friendly. The menu is overwhelmingly large as is expected. I wish they had better beer selections to match my pizza, but otherwise it was a good experience.
Probably the nicest cpk in town. Right by the Capitol. Great staff. Especially Jason behind the bar. He's been there for years and knows his trade.

I USED to love CPK for one thing and one thing only, their Thai Crunch Salad.   Be that as it may; my love has been replaced with extreme annoyance. The Pasadena location offers direct delivery rather then LA Bite to a 3 mile radius.  I took the bait. Our order: Thai Crunch Salad Cobb Salad Pepperoni Sausage Pizza The server who took my phone order did not tell me our total on the phone.  I sometimes ask for a total just to make sure to have the amount plus tip handy.  I figured since it would be around 30....40 should be fine. 15 minutes later, some cholo with a rickshaw bike pulls up to our building and says our total is 47 and some change.  I thought it was a bit high...so I handed him 60, he them proceeds to say " oh...I ain't got no change..I got quarters, though!"  So we decide to not hassle him and tell him to keep it. When we got upstairs we looked at the receipt...not only had we been charged a delivery fee, but we ALSO got charged a 10% gratuity.  I am all about servers getting theirs..but this was straight up shady.  What sort of delivery guy doesn't carry change?  A Lying, cheating bastard one, that's who.   I called the store and asked to speak with the manager.  I know, I know...the guy sounded like he works 85+ hours a week and hates bending over and taking it in the ass from people who take advantage of corporate slaves like him for as much free shit as they can possibly get their meat hooks on.  I am DEFINITELY not one of them, but I was pretty annoyed at the degree of shadiness shown by the delivery guy and wanted to let him know so no one else would fall victim.  The manager says "that it was quite disturbing" for him to hear that...and that he would have a talk with him.  He actually offered to have the cholo RICKSHAW BACK to my HOUSE and bring correct change.  Um....have you HEARD of home invasions?!?!  People's homes have been invaded for far less.  FUUUUCK THAT.  I said no..that would be "awkward".  So then he says "...well..I'm in the hospitality business and my business is to take care of people (gag me with a pitchfork, what corporate honcho added THAT to the script?!!?)  so let me take care of you folks, I'm gonna send you some COUPONS FOR FREE APPETIZERS".   Ok...to add insult to injury....he tried to make the coupons seem SOOO great...what would be minimum restaurant standard is if he gave us a refund or at least told us to come in and the next meal would be on him...free appetizers is really belittling, don't you think?   Oh oh oh oh oh!!!!!! Here's the kicker: He never sent SHIT!!!

If you've been to one CPK you've been to them all. Sad to say I tend to rate huge chains poorly, but with good reason: corporate quality control. Unfortunately I can't say anything about shards of glass in my food (sorry 2 hear Jenny) but I can say the workers are pretty cool making it that much more pleasant for a weekday lunch and really because it's 3 blocks away.  Don't waste time eating all the pizzas, the BBQ chicken is the best by far! If you feel like something sweet, like me, get the pear and gorgonzola one. It's like a salad on top. For salads it's their Waldorf with bleu cheese.
Food is good (same as other CPK), service is nice (same as other CPK), parking is kinda expensive (but I guess it's the general thing in this area?). Overall, it was a not bad experience.

Oh boy... I was not very happy with CPK. Yesterday I went down there for lunch, since I haven't been back to CPK  for a long time, and since my bestfriend really love this place, I thought maybe I would find something yummy on the menu.  I was really starvin' so I ordered the full size Original Chopped salad ($12). And... it was really disappointing. 3 reasons: 1) salad was very like a half order. 2) It was very bland and almost tasteless 3) for $12, I could have gotten a very yummy Diane salad at GSC or Cheesecake Factory chopped salad with the yummy croutons.  Anyways... nothing against CPK, but my salad wasn't yummy.  Maybe I didn't order the right thing but how can you mess up on a salad?? sniff..sniff... Oh yeah... almost forgot, parking is $2.50 with Validation.  CPK only validate up to 1 hour.

Go to any CPK and expect what you expect.  Our food was good and the service was excellent and attentive.  I like something from each part of the menu,  They also have a thing where if you're trying something for the first time and don't like it, you can return it.  It's probably not a new thing but it's the first time I've seen it in writing!   I have no idea where the parking is for this place as I only go when I'm in the area for other reasons.  So if you're shopping or doing a court thing it's a good choice for lunch.

Been here a few times with friends.  The waiting area is the best I've seen...outdoors and spread out...perfect. It was a little crowded but smelled of a wood fire so, bonus! I love the chop salad and focaccia with checca.  I get that every time.  A friend that we were dining with had ordered a tostada pizza with no onions but when it came to the table it clearly had onions.  They took it back and excluded it from the bill.  Sorry folks but that makes this CPK classy in my book.
The parking is harder here than at the Santa Anita Mall.  The service isnt as good, but its roomier.

The service here is terrible. I've come here during my lunch break 3 times now and each time I have to flag someone down to give me the check. It's impossible to get in and out of there within an hour.. and you'll never ever get a drink refill. This is a good place to eat if you have a lot of time to sit around and wait.

The service and staff were very well trained, very friendly and provided excellent service.  But the Pizza (which they are supposed to specialize in) was not good at all.  The "Thin Crust" was so tough you couldn't bite through it and pretty tasteless.  Hardly any cheese either.  The "Fried Mac n Cheese" is AWFUL, greasy, flavorless, dry and super dense.  The salads and soups were much better so there was some saving grace.

Great friendly service delicious pizza. I loved how I was treated by my waitress Sonia, she was very kind and would constantly check up on us how we where doing and kept bringing us refills. I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends and I hope to come back soon.

The food is good / they have definitely updated the menu.  The big problem I have, which has been a consistent issue, is the kitchen just can't seem to keep up / it takes a LONG time to get the food out.  I really feel bad for the wait staff here because it isn't their fault, but it ends up getting reflected in their tips.  Yes, I realize this is a big restaurant, but they have a big kitchen as well.  One time I came and even during off peak it took close to 45 minutes for the food to come out.  There are simply too many options in Pasadena / they can't continue to let this happen or else they will lose customers for good...
CARNE ASADA PIZZA IS THE BOMB! I love the Meat! and everything on it! I also love the Fettuccine pasta with shrimp and mushroom! Those are basically the two dishes that keeps me coming back .

I love this place! Their prices are fair and it's a great place to go as a family. The kid choices are very good with good portion sizes. They have these new call cravings which are delicious! 2 of those will fill me up and it's only about 3 to 5 dollars each! I think this place is very good and affordable!
Really good but really over priced. Just get the ones from the grocery store and choose somewhere else for your night out.
I have been to CPK many of times but must say I was disappointed by the food quality. The waitress was attentive and awesome but the food did not taste fresh. I was not impressed with the food.

me and my wife have been to this location 3 times the last 4 years or so. each time there was always something that didn't go right. the first time the waitress forgot my wife's soup. the waitress offered it for free, but we were almost finish with our dinner by that time so we declined. the next time we went, the pizza and noodle entree we ordered was a bit too salty and the waitress took forever to serve our food. this last time we went, we ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and Ginger Salmon with Noodles. the salad was very good. I recommend ordering the full instead of the half. it's only like $4 more and the half is kind of small. the Salmon was great, not too salty. but the noodles was cold and sticky, like the dish was left on the pickup counter a little too long.  the thing that saved the day each time was the alcohol. I'm not a drinker, but the mixed drink I got each time kind of relaxed me a little. the mojitas are pretty good there....

I'm always too full to get dessert.  My aunt usually gets adobe chicken chowder side by side with the Sedona tortilla soup here.  My boyfriend is more into the Dakota smashed pea soup.  The field greens and Waldorf chicken salads are good.  This is one of the few places I know that offer peach lemonade.

what happened!?!?  i used to go here a lot years back.  then i went again for the first time in a long time and it was terrible.  the food quality was still what i expected for the most part, but some of the other people in my party were not happy - i think it was the eggplant pizza, but it was bland.  Also the dessert we got was really bad - how do you mess up dessert?? anyways it was the service that really bugged me.  it was just very bad, slow, unconcerned, etc.  i think that if the server was good the other stuff might have been less noticeable but becuase we had that to deal with the other stuff just sucked even more. so sad, probably will be another 5 years before i try it again. too bad i like their bbq pizza and bbq chix salad. - will have to order it to go!

i've been coming here a looooooong time and i happen to enjoy CPK a lot.  chain shmain.  in fact it's one of the places we go when i'm uninspired to cook dinner. i've sampled almost all the pizzas and i can't say i haven't tried one i didn't like.  california cuisine is known for fusing cuisines of other countries together and i don't mind all the unique combos.  it's inventive and creative.  and ordering them with the honeywheat dough is even better!  my favorites are the japanese eggplant, the sante fe ckn, and the mango tandoori ckn pizzas.  oh, i was so thrilled when i saw they brought back the tandoori!  now if only they brought the potato leek soup back, the world would be right with me again. the salads are great too and, at the moment,  i especially crave the new grilled veggie one.  the only issues i have with this place is that sometimes the pizza toppings are sparse and salad portions are getting somewhat smaller while the price is inflating.   hopefully, it doesn't get too out of hand...

Consistent for the most part.  Food was much better 5-8 years ago - back when I think they were making more stuff in house vs. pre-made. Ex: pizza crust used to be much better. Also, the soups had better flavor, more depth.  They should get rid of the "free bread".  It's terrible. Put something on the menu that tastes good and sell it as an appetizer.  If it's tasty, people will pay for bread. Overall, a decent job, but I think they are over-rated.

I usually love CPK...this one is nice but for some reason really stuffy and hot. I don't know if their air was out or what but it wasn't very comfortable eating in the heat. I mean who wants to sweat eating their food?!

i'm basically just a big fan of this over-priced chain of very california cuisine. this location was no exception. the only redeeming quality any chain could offer is consistency and I think CPK does it better than any other. the food is precise, the service on point (albiet a little void of true personality), and all the amenities included. i now have to ask for my bread and water instead of getting it automatically like I used to when the chain first made its mark, but I understand, times are tough. i'd rather they cut costs like that than in quality or heaven forbid, raise prices! they're already higher than I like to pay, but again, consistency is underrated. Good job Los Robles... I'm still a CPK lover.
Great CPK with some nice outdoor seating and friendly staff. The parking situation but could improve with a better system for validation.

We arrived in Pasadena very late and  haven't had dinner  yet  So after checking in at the Westin Hotel next door I noticed there was  a California Pizza Kitchen.    My daughter and I shared a full order of the Thai Crunch Salad versus a half order.  The waiter was nice enough to bring our order already divided. It was sooo  full of crunch and texture..  Can't say too much for the pizza.

i think this review is bias, so don't trust it too much.  i live close by and love the kung pao pasta sooo much i always order and tiramisu is to die for.. i don't ever get anything else so give these two things a try.

My family and I usually take advantage of the curb-side pick-up option rather than eating in the restaurant.  Make sure you check your order before leaving though because we've had several cases when the waiter forgot some of our order items.  The food is pretty expensive but tastes good.  My family usually orders the BLT pizza, Jamaican jerk pizza, original BBQ chicken pizza, and the spinach artichoke dip, all of which are tasty.

The quality at this CPK is not as good as others. Staff is friendly but not that informed  about their offerings. The catering menu is way overpriced and items that say will feed 8-10 will feed more like 2 couples (not all big eaters either)  Example: the tortilla springrolls  the waitress told be there are 9 of them per order. Actually there are only 3 of them and each one is cut into 3 pieces and they are about the size of a big tacquito before they cut them up and it's supposed to feed 8-10 people!! They put it in a big sealed foil tub and when we opened it we were surprised to see their measly portions occupy about 1/4 of the tub. To top it off it cost $30. Other items on the catering menu are of equally poor value and quality - discolored and oxidized apples in the salad.  Complained to the manager and he didn't do anything but explain those are the correct sized portions and would talk to his staff about their explanation about the catering menu.

ok i totally love the california pizza kitchen.  they regularly delivered to this office i worked in over the summer.  (everyone lined up early on that day!)  they were always on time when they delivered.   so i decided to walk there for lunch one day with my friend.  it was a saturday and we were hot and they had stella on tap so we sat at the bar and had one... or two... eh who bothers counting if you are drinking before 2 anyway!  the bartender was super friendly and nice.  he was training another girl named sarah who i also had as my waitress another time-- such nice people. totally sat around and chatted with my and my friend.  the head chef manager guy was phenomenal.  he was making things so quickly and obviously took pride in his work.  when he was on his break we chatted with him and told him he was awesome.  he not only was an excellent chef but also very nice to talk to.  we enjoyed are meal soo much (the tricolor salad and chipotle pizza are some favs, although the chinese salad is always a classic)   this location is off union not colorado so if you aren't familiar with the area and just drive down colorado looking for somewhere to have dinner you may miss it, but its definitely worth going to

All CPK's have great vegetarian pizza with whole wheat crust, and will happily make it without cheese for you.  The Pasadena location has nice fancy decor, which helps make you feel a little better about the rampant inflation present in their prices.  Actually I don't know if the prices have inflated, but I do know that it can get very expensive to eat at CPK if you get more than one dish.  Other than that, a good consistent place to eat.  Nice salads and soups.  Infinite refill lemonade is fresh (I think) and tasty.  Skip the disgustingly sweet and overpriced desserts.  At least the apple crisp falls in this category.
CPK! I love the BBQ Chicken pizza! Keep it coming! Atmosphere is... like all other CPKs, who cares. The Pizzas are always great!

i like this location cuz its rite by the westin hotel & city hall very nice setting & my friend lives by there & the ucr alumni dinners r held @ the westin so very conveinant - very usual is this chicken tequila pasta , peach tea , dessert lol tirasumi! i also like going to the riverside 1 in central plaza back in the way & also the 1 in santa anita

I'm a huge fan of gourmet pizza and this place has got a heck of a lot of selection.  The restaurant is pretty big compared to other locations I've been to.  My rave on my favorite pizza would have to be: Wild Mushroom Chicken Pizza on Honey Wheat Bread (it's enough to share for 2 at about $11).  I also love the Chinese Chicken Salad here the sauce is thick and yummy.  Not too fond on any of the "specialty drinks" they always taste weak.

I would probably give CPK a 3-4 star rating. I think everything there is pretty ok. But since my latest visit- I think a bit less of them since they took my favorite pizza off the menu! I know it might be girlie or you might make assumptions about who I am but my favorite pizza was the Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza. Yeah, the one with the salad in the middle of it.  It is definitely not the manliest dish on the menu but I am comfortable enough with myself to order it without reservation. For the past number of visits I wouldn't even open the menu because I already knew what I was going to order. After the news was broken to me I felt so lost and confused. What do I order now? So after this past visit to CPK I think I will take a break from them since my favorite dish was taken from me. I didn't even get a chance to say goodbye. If I would have known- I would have at least given a viking funeral to my last take-out pizza box.

i love CPK i have gone to many in Glendale and Burbank but i did not enjoy my meal or service at this location.. My Bar-B-Q Chicken Pizza had very few pieces of chicken on it and it was not hot enough for me. I also had a salad and the lettuce was not fresh.

I always get the BBQ Chicken Pizza - recently I have learned to add pineapples and bacon to the mix on my BBQ Chicken Pizza.  Its an interesting enough choice where the server told me he would try it next time he had his lunch. Add Mango or Peach Iced Tea to the mix and you got yourself a meal!  Its California PIZZA kitchen, so I only eat pizza there - I don't have the guts to try anything else there.  I know, I know, a pasta house can have excellent pizza so why can't a pizza house have excellent pasta.  That's just me.

I always head to this restaurant 4-5 times a month and sit at the counter/bar. Jayson and Erik are extremely nice and they know their menu. My favorite is the BBQ Chicken Salad and I also enjoy their other salads ( especially their Cobb Salad) I don't drink but I always get an ice tea with other flavors (peach, raspberry, etc. ) When they have seasonal items out I like to try their seasonal items. The pizzas are a good size, enough for 2-3 people to share along with appetizers. I prefer this location over the Arcadia one anytime. The managers say hello to you and come by your table to see how everything is going.

I normally don't write bad reviews on yelp. And if a place is terrible I would just move on and not bother wasting my time writing a review. But feel that I needed to express the disappointment I feel about this location. I love CPK and have been a big fan for years. Ordered the pasta and a salad thru LA bite and specifically requested for special instructions to add extra sauce on pasta and extra dressing on the side. The pasta arrived extremely dry and salad had only 1 container of dressing, not extra as ordered. So I called CPK and spoke to the manager who initially said that they are not responsible because it was ordered thru LA Bite and the payment went thru them. She tried to put it on LA bites that they processed and forwarded the order. But when I asked if they received my specific instructions, the manager looked at the order, then said yes, they see my specific instructions. So I asked then why weren't the instructions followed. All she said was sorry and there's nothing more they can do. I would've appreciated her taking responsibility that they made the error right off the bat instead of trying to put it off to LA bites like they didn't forward CPK the question. But all she said was sorry and that I would need to come and pick up more salad dressing if I wanted more. I was very disappointed by the response especially because they made the error. I was very turned off that she did not even suggest to make up for the error. I wasn't even asking for a refund but needed clarification why it in turned out like this not to mention the chicken tequila fettuccine was so dry and almost sauce less it was prob the worst that's ever tasted from cpk. But I would never order or go to this location ever again. Very disappointed.

I remember when CPK was the bomb!  That was like 10 years ago.  Now I hardly go anymore... prefer the market's bbq chicken pizza like the lazy sob that I am. Well I tried their thin-crust.  Nahh I'll pass.  It gets cold and stiff quickly and it isn't very good.  I'd prefer BJ's thin-crust over this any day.  However, they have great sandwiches!  I love their chicken and cranberry with walnuts.  The bread is amazing and full of savory goodness.   I feel as though CPK could do much better if they concentrated on their classic dishes and improved upon them.  Instead, they seems to have more and more variety, which are equally mediocre.  That's pretty much why chains don't elude us anymore though, right?

I''ve been here several times in the past 3 yrs and every time, it's a good experience. I just had dinner here with a friend and again, it was good. I wouldn't say it was excellent, but the staff is super nice. The good: 1.The food is good. We ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad w/avocado (this is my favorite dish) and Thai bbq Chicken, which is good, but I would never order this, because I'm Asian and do I really want to eat this at an American restaurant? no... but, my friend likes it so, we ordered it.  It's good, I just wouldn't order it. (like seriously, I'm not going to order pad thai at a Vietnamese restaurant). 2. The server was very nice and other people working in the restaurant were very friendly. The bartender reminded us to get our parking validated, which was super helpful. The not so good: 1. My friend asked for sweet and low when we ordered our drinks. The drinks came, but where's the sweet and low? lol... she tells me "how long ago did I ask for sweet and low....." and she asked again. 2. After the waiter brought us our food, he was like running away.  I had to kind of yell after him to ask for red pepper for the pizza and black pepper for the salad.

The food is fine (the menu revamp made it significantly better, though) but I'm giving 5 stars because the service is always excellent.  At our last visit, I had a problem with my pizza dough card.  The manager (Kristin? Christy?) not only tried to solve it, she honored my reward regardless AND she called me today to let me know she had followed up with the IT folks and they fixed the problem.  Holy cow, that is service!

Went there for lunch while fire fighters were doing a fundraiser, which was nice of the restaurant to do. The food at this CPK is pretty similar to other CPKs; nothing special and, therefore, a bit overpriced. Parking is street only and good luck with that, because you are going to need it. Wait time to get a seat and for our food was average.

First off I signed up to yelp just to write this review. That should say something!  Ate here with my kids and my son came home and threw up about 2 hours later. He ate the mac and cheese . He is still moaning and hurting 6 hours later. My wife had a chicken dish and had to stand up and walk around for a few minutes after suddenly feeling queazy. Have had CPK many times but Never AGAIN!
Food was surprisingly good and out waiter was excellent..

Went here many years ago, and has never gone back. Over all food was very CPK, nothing unusual there, the issues was in the service. I went here with my wife (at that time gf) and a friend and his wife (they were married). We were going to do a dinner and movie things, and as our dinner ended, we notice that we had to get going as the movie was starting soon. We looked around and couldn't find our server (they might have been called waiters back then). So we asked another server to get our tab for us. Again, we were running late, so we were rushing the server (not our guy, cause we still hadn't seen him). We paid, left a tip and got up to leave, never seeing our server again. As we got to elevator, waiting for it to reach our floor, the server ran out and asked if he had provided us with bad service. Once again, we didn't think service was bad (very slow, but not bad), until the next thing happened. After we quickly explained our situation (all before the elevator arrived), he asked by the tip was so little? WTF! seriously!? Even with the slow service, we left a nice 15% tip...what more can you ask! Never going back to this place.
I can not remember the last time I have ordered something different rather than the Pan Sauteed Salmon I always get!   Typical CPK...you are going to like it!

I have always liked CPK, as do my kids, but why did they stop serving butter with the bread?? Do they really think kids want to dip their bread in olive oil and herbs??  This  is a kid friendly/family restaurant, so bring back the butter CPK!  As for the olive oil, it needs balsamic vinegar.

I dislike CPK very much, it's an abomination .  Real Pizza does not taste like this at all.  I gave it three stars and not one because well, I'm not from here, I've never been into the California cuisine and suddenly I realize, it's not the restaurant I hate, it's the trickery in the name.  If you come here as an outsider, you'd think "oh ok Pizza cool"  no not Pizza, California Pizza, it's not traditional NY style, it's not that greasy italian pizza that slides off with the gooey cheese and oils that make a pizza a pizza.   But I set my expectations too high.  I try to acclimate myself to the very different food here on the west coast, and have done well, (aside from cilantro)., but I just don't get CPK.  However, it is unfair for me to give a 1 or a 2 star rating simply because I'm an outsider, so I had to give it a 3 and say, I understand, but it's just not my thing.
Very good pizza like all the CPK's but this was extra special since we went vegetarian the waiter helped us make an amazing selection he was great two out two young sons and just grade A service

One of my all time favorite places, I've never had a bad meal here and I've been coming here for many years. Love the Thai Chicken Pizza on Honey Wheat Dough. Split a bottle of the Jacob's Creek Moscato with girlfriends and we LOVED it. Great service and a nice place to go, they have something for everyone.

The New peach salad is wonderful and the Bartenders in Pasadena, Jayson and, Erick are the best ! Jeff is great at take out !Oh yes and Sonia too.. Great managers in Pasadena !! Go Pasadena ! Great Restaurant...Oh and the last 2 weeks we have been eating & eating the strawberry shortcake with ice cream mmmm :) Only for summer :(
Good selection of salads. Food is delicious. Service is a bit slow.

The food is good just like at any other CPK. The location is very crowded but it is convniently located for me. The service has been great every time I have been there and I have been there many times. Even though it's very crowded I don't mind enough to stop going because everything else is great.

Service is usually slow because this location gets really busy. They seem to need more servers. This location attracts a lot of families with young children too-- Maybe because of the large fountain out front. Overall the food is usually always good, the Caribbean sunset sangria is delicious and the servers are friendly. Parking is validated for 90 minutes.
